ovdesc.p: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing OPTION.TRADE transactions.
These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type. The user must create on record for each company on the system.

desc.p: The default TRANSACTION code for all Credit transactions within OPTION.TRADE where market profit & loss occurs.
To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code to the application to which it refers ranges have been assigned to each application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24:
600 - 649 = Securities
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
Specifies the nominee company in whose name a security is registered.
In the eventuality that all OPTION.TRADES within a company are settled into and out of a particular nominee company this field would contain the standard default key for that nominee company.
1-5 Alphanumeric input, (type S) standard nominee code. (Optional Input)
Must exist on the NOMINEE.CODE table
The debit TRANSACTION code for all market profit & loss entries within the OPTION.TRADE.
To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code to the application to which it refers ranges have been assigned to each application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24:
600 - 649 = Securities
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
(Mandatory Input)
Specifies the profit & loss category for any potential 'Market' profit or loss with an OPTION.TRADE.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction within T24 will be allocated a CATEGORY code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operations.
Note: At the moment the customer price must equal broker price so there is no possible chance of market profit and loss occuring within an OPTION.TRADE.
4 or 5 numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input)
Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
Specifies the COMPANY to which the user must be signed on in order to use the application.

9 alphanumerid characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters COUNTRY Code GGG is 3 numeric characters COMPANY Group LLLL is 4 numeric local code or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') Company Mnemonic characters.
Must exist as a valid COMPANY code.
Specifies the type of delivery involved in settling any OPTION.TRADE.
Used as the standard delivery instructions for any particular OPTION.TRADE. It may, however, be changed at transaction level.
1-5 Alphanumeric characters, (type 'S') standard delivery instruction. (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the SC.DEL.INSTR table.
